page.title: 12Rogart - Trade (Post Office)
page.content: Everybody in Rogart uses the Post Office (commonly known as the P.O.). Until 1979, the P.O. was in the Cross House. Today, it is in a specially built building. Mr Mackenzie owns the P.O.. He employs four full-time workers and four part-time workers. It is not only a Post Office, but stocks everything you can think of (from a thimble to a giant panda). He supplies the community's groceries. It is open from Monday to Saturday every week of the year. On Thursday afternoon it is closed, but reopens at 4p.m. to supply everybody with the local Sutherland newspaper - "The Northern Times" or "Raggie" as everyone calls it. In the winter-time some people walk to the P.O.. If you can't walk there, neighbours will help ypu.
